name: Scenario 5: Unusual Location Login Detection
description: When an attacker successfully logs in with stolen credentials, they often access from unusual locations. This scenario demonstrates geolocation-based anomaly detection. You'll see a successful login from a country the user has never accessed from before, followed by impossible travel patterns (same user appearing in different countries within minutes). Learn to recognize these red flags and take immediate action to secure the compromised account.

events.title: Successful Login from Unusual Location
events.description: User 'jdoe' logged in from UA; normal is US.

events.title: Impossible Travel
events.description: jdoe observed from UA then US within 10 minutes.

events.title: Geolocation Anomaly Score
events.description: High risk score: 95/100 for jdoe session.

events.title: New Device Registration
events.description: Unknown device 'Windows 10' registered from UA location.

events.title: Accessing Sensitive Resources
events.description: jdoe accessing customer database from unusual location.
You've detected a successful login from an unusual location with impossible travel patterns. What is your response?

options.text: Immediately disable the account and force password reset
options.explanation: Account disablement prevents further unauthorized access.

options.text: Require MFA verification for this session
options.explanation: MFA adds a layer but doesn't stop an already-compromised session.

options.text: Monitor the session for suspicious activity
options.explanation: Monitoring alone doesn't prevent potential data exfiltration.
Attacker may have already established session or can use different IPs.
